posts.post_content:
Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.  
  
This card is referencing [Raise Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raise Dead).
posts.html:
Each Time Spiral card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.

This card is referencing Raise Dead.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Missile_Penguin (3/11/2012 1:45:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Its plain effect is worse than [Raise Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raise Dead), but it's countered by the fact that Madness allows you to play it at any time. Instant-speed graveyard card grabs aren't the most useful thing in the world, but they aren't bad. Also, it's worth noting that this card can return more than just mono-colored creatures, e.g. you could return your [Psychatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Psychatog), if you were the sort of sick deviant person to be playing with a Psychatog in the first place.  
  
@djflo: As far as I understand, because the discard would be a cost both cards are considered discarded immediately with the same "timestamp", meaning you decide which one gets placed in the graveyard first. Once that happens, then replacement effects (e.g. Madness) come into play. The replacement effect places the spell on the stack "the next time you could play an instant," i.e. AFTER the cards have already been discarded, meaning that yes, you could bring the black creature you just discarded back to y... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Its plain effect is worse than Raise Dead, but it's countered by the fact that Madness allows you to play it at any time. Instant-speed graveyard card grabs aren't the most useful thing in the world, but they aren't bad. Also, it's worth noting that this card can return more than just mono-colored creatures, e.g. you could return your Psychatog, if you were the sort of sick deviant person to be playing with a Psychatog in the first place.

@djflo: As far as I understand, because the discard would be a cost both cards are considered discarded immediately with the same "timestamp", meaning you decide which one gets placed in the graveyard first. Once that happens, then replacement effects (e.g. Madness) come into play. The replacement effect places the spell on the stack "the next time you could play an instant," i.e. AFTER the cards have already been discarded, meaning that yes, you could bring the black creature you just discarded back to y... Posted By: Undertakerx7 (11/11/2011 11:13:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For anyone looking for a strictly better [Raise Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raise Dead)/[Disentomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disentomb), take a look at [Ghoulcaller's Chant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghoulcaller's Chant).
  
IMO it's not so much worse than the cards mentioned above. Raise Dead effects are undeniably useful, but you don't see them getting a lot of play outside drafts/limited, not even in casual, so spells such as this ( with a more specific niche) end up been played more than the originals.
posts.html:
For anyone looking for a strictly better Raise Dead/Disentomb, take a look at Ghoulcaller's Chant.
IMO it's not so much worse than the cards mentioned above. Raise Dead effects are undeniably useful, but you don't see them getting a lot of play outside drafts/limited, not even in casual, so spells such as this ( with a more specific niche) end up been played more than the originals.
